result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J. Marckx

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Jason J. Marckx appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. State notes no status of counsel filed from PD Office. Def. states he is not eligible for a PD in Forest County. Court advises Def. to re apply in Langlade County or request for court appointed attorney.  Bond remains.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

1:28 PM Defendant Jason J. Marckx appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail, via zoom.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Kelly Hays in court, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. or represent self. State gives bail/bond recommendation, $1,500 cash bond, with conditions, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. has nothing. Court orders $1500 cash bond  Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
